intro: Mussaenda crinita, commonly known as the silky Mussaenda, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a soft, silky texture, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Mussaenda crinita is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
